qas.question: What group did the Manchus take over to add strength to their numbers?
What weapon helped the Ming defeat the Manchus?
When did the Manchus create their own artillery?

context: There were too few ethnic Manchus to conquer China, so they gained strength by defeating and absorbing <a0_0>Mongols<a0_0/>, but more importantly, adding Han Chinese to the Eight Banners. The Manchus had to create an entire "Jiu Han jun" (Old Han Army) due to the massive amount of Han Chinese soldiers which were absorbed into the Eight Banners by both capture and defection, Ming <a1_0>artillery<a1_0/> was responsible for many victories against the Manchus, so the Manchus established an artillery corps made out of Han Chinese soldiers in <a2_0>1641<a2_0/> and the swelling of Han Chinese numbers in the Eight Banners led in 1642 of all Eight Han Banners being created. It was defected Ming Han Chinese armies which conquered southern China for the Qing.
